author: Master_Wu
title: Not a big fan
review:
This is another Mixel that I did not find very exiting. It's an interesting build, but the parts and play value aren't all that good.

I do like the trans purple parts and quite a few of the others, but you can't build too much else with just this set alone.

I would recommend this set mainly to Mixel collectors, or those who just want some special parts.

author: Slobrojoe
title: Gandalf gone purple?
review:
Mixels have brought rare pieces to the Lego world for little expenses. Although MOCable, are these sets actually decent? This is Magnifo from series 3.

Minifig

This set contains no minifigures.

Box/Instructions 

This set comes in a small plastic packet. It is hard to open without ripping if you're a collector. The instructions are 25 pages long with easy to follow steps.
 

Parts

The parts are mostly purple and black. There are some white and blue pieces as well.

Build

The build is quite short and enjoyable, taking only between 5-7 minutes. There is a lot of repetition in the build.

Completed model

This is my favourite model in the series. He has two light sabre translucent purple as wands. He has a cone shaped wizard's hat. There are two pointed teeth and a printed single eye. There is also a mini monster that is not shown on the packet.

This set is definitely one to get, for MOCs or not.
